lea.text: In my team we know where and how to address roadblocks
My teams leaders remove the roadblocks for us
My teams leaders support our cultural transformation
We get the right enabling measures and tools to work in an agile set-up
We have a continuous dialogue with our leaders about the responsibilities in the team
My teams leaders continuously deploy responsibilities into the team
My teams leaders accept and trust our decisions
Decentralized Decision Making - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
lea.opt1: Decisions are centralized, regardless of frequency, time criticality, and impact
lea.opt2: Decisions are rarely decentralized even if they are frequent, time critical, and do not have global economies of scale
lea.opt3: Decisions are sometimes decentralized when they are frequent, time critical, and do not have global economies of scale
lea.opt4: Decisions are usually decentralized when they are frequent, time critical, and do not have global economies of scale
lea.opt5: Decisions are always decentralized when they are frequent, time critical, and do not have global economies of scale

lea.text: Many of the improvements identified in the retrospective are implemented in the next Sprint
Team members raise impediments at the daily meetings

pro.text: In my team we know our users and maintain an active dialogue with them
My team understands the needs and requirements of our users
In my team we focus all our work on the needs / expectations of our users
My team understands the needs and requirements of our dealers
We offer the right support & material to our dealers to generate demand for a successful business with our Accessories
We know the level of the quality our customers expect
My team meets the quality expectations
In my team everybody knows our quality standards
Time to Market: We regularly achieve the Start of Launch we have planned
In my team we inspect and adapt possible bottlenecks in our value chain
Time to Market: We consider & respect our lead times
Team Level Product Management  - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
pro.opt2: Working towards the next level over.
pro.opt3: There is a single product-oriented person that does all of the following: making sure that there are sufficient ready stories at all times, attending all team-oriented planning meetings, accepting stories (for instance during iteration review), prioritizing the backlog. This person is available to fully answer questions about stories that are for the next 2-4 weeks immediately most of the time and within a couple of hours once in a while.
pro.opt4: 80% of the time, people that have an opinion on the content or priority of a user story go to the team-level product person and not to members of the team. There is very close alignment between any product management people outside of the team level and the team level product person.
pro.opt5: There is an amazing repoir and alignment between strategic level product management, team level product management, and the team. Everybody understands and is executing on the product vision and all interaction within product management and the team and everybody follows well understood patterns and works smoothly.

pro.text: Cycle Time  - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
pro.opt1: One year or more from concept to release capability
pro.opt2: Can go from concept to release capability in 6 months.
pro.opt3: All work goes from concept to release in 3 months or less.
pro.opt4: All work goes from concept to release in 2 months or less and it is possible to come from concept to release in weeks.
pro.opt5: It is possible to get from concept to release in a few days.

pro.text: Product Vision  - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
pro.opt2: It is written down somewhere or the product owner or a similar person knows what it is.
pro.opt3: There is a written definition that is precise and known to all involved.
pro.opt4: There is a convincing product vision that can be clearly formulated by the product owner or a similar person.
pro.opt5: Simple, clear, convincing, all participants can articulate it well.

pro.text: The Product Owner has direct contact with customers
We usually capture many detailed requirements at the beginning of the project

tco.text: In my team we do have a regular sprint planning and review
In my team we do define deliverables and acceptance criteria
In my team we do regularly complete our tasks
In my team we defined our decision making processes and everybody understands them
In my team we help and support each other
In my team we synchronize our work regularly based on our needs and targets
We do work cross-functional in my team (within the team itself and with interfacing teams)
We do have the required competences in the team
In the team we all have the same understanding of our roles and responsibilities
I know what I can expect from others and what others can expect from me
In my team we do prioritize our projects according to available capacities
In my team we do limit our Work In Progress (WIP)
We do have a consistent team set-up
We are fully committed to our Purpose, Targets and Roadmap
We do take responsibility for our actions and decisions as a team
My teams backlog is owned and prioritized
We continuously review / renew the backlog (e.g. integration of user / customer feedback)
In my team we have clear targets for our meetings and meet them regularly
In my team we have the right amount of meetings, the right content, frequency and participants
In my team we document outcomes of our meetings in a transparent and understandable way
Meetings - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tco.opt1: There are no regular meetings in the team
tco.opt2: Regular scheduled meetings with the core team
tco.opt3: Regular meetings with 80% of the team
tco.opt4: Regular meetings with the whole team less frequent than once a week
tco.opt5: Meetings with the whole team at least once a week

tco.text: Cross-functional - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tco.opt1: A significant part of what is needed to realize the stories exists outside the team.
tco.opt2: Some of the skills necessary to do the stories exist outside the team.
tco.opt3: All the necessary skills to carry out the work are available in the team.
tco.opt4: All of the necessary skills for performing the work exist on the team and there is some cross training of skills
tco.opt5: All the necessary skills to carry out the work are available in the team and most of the team is prepared for most of these skills.

tco.text: Standups / Check-Ins / Huddles / Coffe Meetings  - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tco.opt2: Regularly taking place and on the way to Level 3.
tco.opt3: 80% of the team participate regularly, the main meeting lasts less than 20 minutes, real obstacles are addressed regularly, the focus is on working for this team, the team understands that the meeting is for them.
tco.opt4: Daily, short, efficient. Works well with or without someone officially in charge of the meeting. The team conducts an on-site analysis of current issues and takes corrective action as required.
tco.opt5: Positively tailored to the needs of the team.

tco.text: Retrospectives - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tco.opt2: Held but not regular or not frequent enough.
tco.opt3: Held regularly, well attended, produces action items. Action items are frequently acted on.
tco.opt4: Regularly taking place, well attended, it produces action items. Action items are often processed.
tco.opt5: Creatively managed, format varies from time to time, future-oriented, often produces groundbreaking ideas that are implemented and lead to tangible results.

tco.text: Estimation of workload  - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tco.opt1: Ad-hoc, persons other than those who perform the work make the estimate, or the estimate is based on the work of each function that has been put together.
tco.opt3: The whole team participates in the estimation, estimates are a single measure of work for the whole team (e.g. user points, T-shirt sizes, etc.). Most team members no longer think in pure time based-estimation (e.g., FTE, hours).
tco.opt4: 90+% of the time estimate involves the entire team by using the estimate of the entire team.
tco.opt5: Consistently performed at least weekly by the entire team using techniques to get an estimation of the entire team.

tco.text: Team Size - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tco.opt2: It is recognised that a smaller team size is required and there is either a short-term plan or the team is actively reduced.

tco.text: Dedicated Team - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tco.opt1: Most team members are in several teams or work on several projects or have a line function.
tco.opt2: Most people are at least 50% assigned to the team. No one is less than 30% of the team.
tco.opt3: Most persons are assigned to the team to >=70%. No one is less than 50% assigned to the team.
tco.opt4: Most people are >=90% assigned to the team. No one is less than 70% assigned to the team.
tco.opt5: Most people are 100% assigned to the team, nobody is less than 60% assigned to the team.

tco.text: The Team Members are able to step outside their role and be cross functional
Decisions need to be formally documented so we know what was agreed
The product we are working on reflects our decisions. We do not need detailed history of previous conversations.

tcu.text: We do have quick and easy access to all information we need for our work
We are involved to the right degree (neither too much nor too little)
We have working tools which support transparency (e.g. team boards, ...)
We respect each other's competences and expertise in my team
We accept failure and do learn from them
We do listen to each other in my team and accept divers opinions
Risk awareness: We do identify potential risks systematically
As a team we do manage risks adequately
We do reflect our methods, tools, behaviours continuously
We do adapt the way we work based on our experiences
We do incorporate successes and improvements in future iterations
We do know all our stakeholders and their trigger points
As a team we know what our stakeholders expect from us
We do involve our stakeholders at the right rime and in the right way
My team is accepted and appreciated by its stakeholders
I do feel appreciated for my contributions in my team
In my team we do celebrate our success and achievements regularly
Stakeholder Involvement
tcu.opt1: Stakeholders are not involved in the creation of a solution
tcu.opt2: Stakeholders are loosely in contact with the team to discuss deliverables
tcu.opt3: There is a regular and stuctured exchange between stakeholders and team members
tcu.opt4: Stakeholders are involved in the working process and are informed about the different challenges
tcu.opt5: Stakeholders are closely involved in the working process and can access the current state of work (i.e. by giving them access to the team board)

tcu.text: Team Morale - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tcu.opt1: Active resistance to change. People often make hints about resigning or how bad the working environment or climate is.  Behavioural patterns such as finger pointing, denial, anger, screaming, betrayal, passive aggression and/or scapegoat regularly occur.
tcu.opt2: There are still some of the behaviors of the previous situation, but steady improvements are emerging away from these problem areas. Problems are addressed activelly and purposefully with a common awareness that morale is improving.
tcu.opt3: In general, people like to work together and are happy with their work.
tcu.opt4: The team is productive, committed with a good team morale. In general, everyone works motivated and purposefully.
tcu.opt5: The majority of the team members enjoy coming to work and look forward to the tasks ahead and feel they are part of one of the best teams they have ever worked in.

tcu.text: Teamwork - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tcu.opt3: At least 70 percent of the optimal setting
tcu.opt4: Optimal setting is in sight - not far away of the ideal state 20 percent to go.
tcu.opt5: Between each individual and every other individual on the team, each believes that the other has the necessary skills, has high integrity, wants and helps them to succeed, and is dependable.

tcu.text: Tuckman Stage - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tcu.opt1: Forming. Assemble a new team or integrating a team member who has joined or left the team.
tcu.opt2: Storming. The team is just starting to figure out how to work together, and there is an unusual frequency of conflicts.
tcu.opt3: Norming. The team has discovered the best way to work well together as a team and is on its way to achieving excellence performance.
tcu.opt4: Have performed consistently for at least two months.
tcu.opt5: Have performed consistently for at least six months.

tcu.text: Sustainable Pace - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tcu.opt1: People are tired, irritable, burned out, working overtime routinely. The present circumstances are considered business as usual.
tcu.opt2: It is acknowledged that the current pace is not sustainable and measures are being taken to improve the overall situation.
tcu.opt3: There is broad acceptance that the team is working at a pace that is almost sustainable indefinitely, although the workload still does not correlate with the outbursts of heavy workloads.
tcu.opt4: The team is supported by the organisation to work at a continuous speed. The team agrees that in 80% of cases the team works in line with the elements of sustainable speed in its team agreement.
tcu.opt5: The company and the team take active measures to support work at a sustainable pace.

tcu.text: Discussion, criticizing and experimenting with the process is welcome
Feedback is encouraged and captured at regular team meetings
Overtime is rare and happens voluntarily
All Team members participate in the daily meetings
Delivering value is more important than delivering to specification
Speed to market is more important than perfection

tpe.text: In my team we do believe in ourselves
Others believe in my teams abilities
In my team we do plan realistically
In my team we do act responsibly
Our stakeholders trust in my teams planning
We do react to changes openly
We do consider the effects of changes in our backlog
Ressource Fluidity - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tpe.opt1: Resources are fix and can not be moved.
tpe.opt2: Resources are checked and assigned twice a year.
tpe.opt3: Resources are allocated on a quarterly basisResources are checked and assigned on a quarterly basis.
tpe.opt4: The resources are allocated quarterly additional resources can be requested - duration about 1-2 months.
tpe.opt5: Ressources can be reassigned and/or moved within a few weeks notice if neccessary.

tpe.text: Environmental Scanning - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tpe.opt1: There is no sense and urgency on where to scan and actively search for information and opportunities within the organization.
tpe.opt2: There is very limited sense to scan for new opportunities. Occasionally, there are impulses on where to look for opportunities and information.
tpe.opt3: There is an understanding that environmental scanning is vital and it is on managerial levels.
tpe.opt4: The organization has developed a good sense on where to scan for new opportunities and or developments (e.g., in technology, markets etc.)
tpe.opt5: The organization has developed a strong sense on where to scan for new opportunities and or developments (e.g., in technology, markets etc.)

tpe.text: Knowledge Acquisition - Which answer describes the situation in your team the best?
tpe.opt1: The organization relies completely on external information supply e.g., consulting firms
tpe.opt2: The organization acquires new knowledge only sporatically over undefined sources. No process of systematically knowledge acquisition
tpe.opt3: The organization is systermatically generating new knowledge e.g. over complaint management, sales meeting etc.
tpe.opt4: The organization has a defined process of knowledge acquisition in different areas. the condensation of knowledge is unstructured. The knowledge is collected often without purpose.
tpe.opt5: The organization has a strong network of knowledge and a dedicated knowledge akquisition process in place (e.g., chatting with customers and suppliers)

tpe.text: The Business Owner is empowered to remove impediments for the Team
The project team can make decisions and provide information when they are required (Just In Time)
The Team's historical velocity is used for Sprint Planning

vis.text: I know my teams business targets
We do have a common target definition process in my team
In my team we do verify and re-priritize our targets regularly
In my team we do reflect our activities in a roadmap
In my team we do continuously adapt our roadmap
My teams roadmap fits to the overall strategy
What percentage of planned story points do we reach in a typical sprint?
Sprints are not interrupted by unplanned work outside of the Sprint Backlog
